title: 112_s366
content: The Act titled "Iran Transparency and Accountability Act of 2011" requires disclosures to the Securities and Exchange Commission regarding sanctionable activities. The Securities Exchange Act of 1934 is amended to require issuers to disclose activities related to Iran, terrorism, and weapons of mass destruction in their annual or quarterly reports. The text chunk discusses violations related to transactions with persons blocked under Executive Order 13224 regarding terrorism support. The curr_chunk discusses activities that may require specific disclosure by an issuer or its affiliate, including engaging in transactions with persons whose property is blocked under Executive Order 13382 or listed in the Iranian Transactions Regulations. The curr_chunk requires detailed disclosure of activities, such as nature, revenues, and intent to continue. The Commission will investigate reports of engaging in sanctioned activities under the Iran Sanctions Act. The Commission will investigate reports of engaging in sanctioned activities under the Iran Sanctions Act and make a determination on imposing sanctions within 180 days. Information provided to the Commission will be made public and posted on its website. The amendment requires providing information to the President and specific congressional committees. The provisions will end 30 days after the President certifies under the Iran Sanctions Act. The effective date applies to future reports. The amendment requires information to be provided to the President and specific congressional committees, with the provisions ending 30 days after the President certifies under the Iran Sanctions Act. The effective date for the new reporting requirements will take effect 90 days after the enactment of this Act for reports filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission. SEC. 3. Deadline for regulations regarding financial institutions maintaining accounts for foreign financial institutions: Amends Section 104(e)(1) of the Comprehensive Iran Sanctions, Accountability, and Divestment Act of 2010 to require the Secretary to act within 90 days of the enactment of the Iran Transparency and Accountability Act of 2011.
